# resignKey()

**Instance Method**

Resigns the window’s key window status.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func resignKey()
```

## Discussion

This method sends [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/resignKey()] to the window’s first responder, sends [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowDelegate/windowDidResignKey(_:)] to the window’s delegate, and posts [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/didResignKeyNotification] to the default notification center.

Never invoke this method directly.

## Related Documentation

- **resignMain()**: Resigns the window’s main window status.

## Managing Key Status

- **isKeyWindow**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window is the key window for the application.
- **canBecomeKey**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window can become the key window.
- **makeKey()**: Makes the window the key window.
- **makeKeyAndOrderFront(_:)**: Moves the window to the front of the screen list, within its level, and makes it the key window; that is, it shows the window.
- **becomeKey()**: Informs the window that it has become the key window.
